adr_address: 76 Av. Charras, 63000 Clermont-Ferrand, France
name: Hôtel de la Gare

reviews.text: I took an emergency night to help out so I'm not going to complain about it. The room was okay, apparently clean but what bothered me was the security. I'm a 22 year old student and I admit I was only able to sleep for a few hours because I wasn't reassured by the noise, the slamming doors... I didn't dare go to the toilet which was on the landing... No one at reception which isn't reassuring either. No soundproofing... No gel in the shower. It's really a hotel for emergency use but that's all

ABSOLUTELY AVOID unless you want to risk finding yourself without a hotel to stay in on the day of your arrival! I had booked a room in this hotel more than a month in advance to be able to attend my exams. As agreed when I booked, I was supposed to pick up the keys at 5 p.m. Luckily, I called late in the morning to see if I could finally check in early in the afternoon and a man told me that the hotel was full, that he was not aware of my reservation (I had booked directly by phone, they had asked me for my contact details, etc.) and he told me that I just had to go and find a room at the hotel next door!!!!!! What a lack of seriousness and professionalism... It's a disgrace!!!!!!

The only night I stayed there, I woke up very sore....
The maid comes in at 8:00 a.m. without knocking with her ID card, and when she sees we're in bed, she says "good morning, sir" (I'm a woman).
So I told her, "Get out of here!"
Don't knock, come in without saying anything, you're insulting people, no apologies... in short. Bad experience.
Low-cost room.

Hotel de la gare infested with bedbugs for 1 week Hotel not maintained daily no staff for cleaning room darkly cleaned after the occupant leaves nothing to do about bedbugs photo on site not contractual these rooms shown do not exist
Cafard dans la chambre, odeur insupportable de cigare froid, toxico et dealer dans l entrée... Le pire hôtel jamais vu
